params._assetOne: Address of first asset in pair
params._assetTwo: Address of second asset in pair

params._adapters: List of adapters used to price assets created by other protocols
params._assetOnes: List of first asset in pair, index i maps to same index in assetTwos and oracles
params._assetTwos: List of second asset in pair, index i maps to same index in assetOnes and oracles
params._masterQuoteAsset: Address of asset that can be used to link unrelated asset pairs
params._oracles: List of oracles, index i maps to same index in assetOnes and assetTwos

params._newMasterQuoteAsset: New address of master quote asset

params._assetOne: Address of first asset in pair
params._assetTwo: Address of second asset in pair
params._oracle: Address of asset pair's new oracle

params._assetOne: Address of first asset in pair
params._assetTwo: Address of second asset in pair

returns._0: Price of asset pair to 18 decimals of precision

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._assetOne: Address of first asset in pair
params._assetTwo: Address of second asset in pair

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addAdapter(address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Add new oracle adapter.

addPair(address,address,address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Add new asset pair oracle.

methods.constructor: Set state variables and map asset pairs to their oracles

editMasterQuoteAsset(address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Change the master quote asset.

editPair(address,address,address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Edit an existing asset pair's oracle.

getPrice(address,address).notice: SYSTEM-ONLY PRIVELEGE: Find price of passed asset pair, if possible. The steps it takes are:  1) Check to see if a direct or inverse oracle of the pair exists,  2) If not, use masterQuoteAsset to link pairs together (i.e. BTC/ETH and ETH/USDC     could be used to calculate BTC/USDC).  3) If not, check oracle adapters in case one or more of the assets needs external protocol data     to price.  4) If all steps fail, revert.

removePair(address,address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Remove asset pair's oracle.
